history.content: I'd say take at least 106A before deciding that for yourself, since an actual robotics class is a better measure than 16B. Research + robotics-related classes like 188 are also things to consider. Don't give up on your interests just because 1 non-essential (in the context of robotics) class is giving you a hard time, especially given everything going on this semester

children.subject: +1 to this! Also highly recommend EE 120 - it does a great job of creating a foundation for the controls side of robotics work if that's what you're into. Also IMO a must-take for anyone pursuing upper-div EE.

Yes +1 to Ishaan's resposne please take 106A!  While material in 16B is sort of backbone to a lot of things EE, getting a more applied experience through a class like 106A, 149, or 192 might be what you need to see the dots connect. Out of the classes I listed, I've only taken 106A, but I highly recommend to anyone with a remote interest in robotics.

CS 188 covers essential material for robotics if you are interested in imbuing robots with AI. For a long time, robots have been programmed using control (electrical engineering, think Boston Dynamics). However, the problem with control algorithms is that they require knowledge about how the world operates (known as a model of the world). CS 188 introduces you to how controlling a robot may be done given uncertainty about these aspects (as very much seen in real life). It covers probabilistic reasoning and simple reinforcement learning algorithms which may, in the future, replace control algorithms to allow for more robust policies (who knows what the future has in store for us?)
Could you clarify how CS 188 is a robotics-related class? What sort of material do they cover that is similar to it?

history.content:
I'm interested in further pursuing robotics/linear algebra/ee, but I'm having a tough time with 16B. Frankly, I don't feel engaged with the class but can't tell whether or not it's simply because of the material itself or the way it's being taught. 

Has anyone had a similar experience? I'm already declared, if that makes a difference.
history.subject: Robotics right for me?
